item.title: Sourcecode markup tweaks in Wordpress
item.description: I noticed in Ed Stevens' blog posting here that some sourcecode he’d posted had certain lines highlighted. Wordpress provides the sourcecode tag for marking up sourcecode in blog posts. For example: cd /some/random/folder ls -l # do not run this next line! is much better presented as: [sourcecode language=“bash”] cd /some/random/folder ls -l # do not run this next line! [/sourcecode] by wrapping it in [sourcecode] tags I’ve known about the language=‘xx’ attribute that you can use with the tag, but Ed’s posting prompted me to check on the syntax and it turns out there a few tweaks one can use.
